author: uldisv
body:
# Steps to reproduce
In powershell 7.0.0 on Windows 10 Pro 1909. Hardware: Msi GE72 6QF Notebook.

1) Open powershell 7
2) Press "Fn" key.

# Expected behavior
No echo in powershell - because it's a dead key, next key will determine behaviour.

# Actual behavior
In powershell "@" symbol is printed.
If next key is pressed - Fn functionality works as expected, just every press leaves new "@" in the console.

# Environment data

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18363
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

```

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
@uldisv I'd recommend seeing if this reproduces without PSReadLine imported. If not, you may want to report it to the https://github.com/PowerShell/PSReadLine repository instead. 🙂
GitHub
PowerShell/PSReadLine
A bash inspired readline implementation for PowerShell - PowerShell/PSReadLine

comments.author: uldisv
comments.body:
> @uldisv I'd recommend seeing if this reproduces without PSReadLine imported. If not, you may want to report it to the https://github.com/PowerShell/PSReadLine repository instead. 🙂 > > > GitHub**[PowerShell/PSReadLine](https://github.com/PowerShell/PSReadLine)**A bash inspired readline implementation for PowerShell - PowerShell/PSReadLine You're right. It's a PSreadline module problem. Removed module - everything works like a charm!

title: Powershell 7 types "@" in console when Fn key pressed
